pulltitle: feat(totp): add ability to request 2fa on login
pullsbody:
Connects to https://github.com/mozilla/fxa-oauth-server/issues/520

Fixes https://github.com/mozilla/123done/issues/172

This PR adds a button that adds the `acr_values=AAL2` param to the oauth request. This option is used in https://github.com/mozilla/fxa-content-server/pull/6545 to request TOTP.

pulltitle: feat(email-first): Add support for the email-first flow.
pullsbody:
Added a new button to handle email-first.

Because the FxaRelierClient has been deprecated and
I didn't want to update it to handle email-first, I removed
it from the dependency tree and built the query parameter
manually.

fixes #166 

@vladikoff - r?
pull_commit_message:
feat(email-first): Add support for the email-first flow.

Added a new button to handle email-first.

Because the FxaRelierClient has been deprecated and
I didn't want to update it to handle email-first, I removed
it from the dependency tree and built the query parameter
manually.

fixes #166

pulltitle: Display a :lock: icon for users who signed in with 2FA
pull_commit_message:
fix(preverify): remove obsolete code that was for preVerifyToken support

The preVerifyToken functionality was removed in #158 so AFAICT
this code is no longer required.

pulltitle: Display a :lock: icon for users who signed in with 2FA
pull_commit_message:
feat(oidc): Replace custom FxA flows with standard OpenID Connect.

This simplifies away a bunch of knowledge about the FxA server
ecosystem, replacing it with a lookup of the standard OpenID Connect
discovery document at /.well-known/openid-configuration.

It also probably breaks the "iframe" oauth flow, but I don't
think we're using that anywhere...?

pulltitle: Display a :lock: icon for users who signed in with 2FA
pull_commit_message: feat(amr): Reflect 2FA login status with a `lock` icon.

pulltitle: fix: Update fxa-relier-client to redirect off of the oauth server.
pullsbody: The newest fxa-relier-client bounces off the oauth server instead of going directly to the content server. To handle this, we have to pass the oauth authorization URL to the relier-client on startup.
pull_commit_message:
fix: Update fxa-relier-client to redirect off of the oauth server.

The relier client needs to know both the oauth and content server hosts.

The newest fxa-relier-client bounces off the oauth server instead of going directly to the content server. To handle this, we have to pass both the content server URI and oauth server URI to the relier-client on startup.

pulltitle: fix: Update fxa-relier-client to redirect off of the oauth server.
pullsbody: The newest fxa-relier-client bounces off the oauth server instead of going directly to the content server. To handle this, we have to pass the oauth authorization URL to the relier-client on startup.
pull_commit_message: update to fxa-relier-client#0.0.2

Set 123done up to serve either the iframe flow or the standard oauth flow.

Uses the fxa-relier-client

browse to `/` to use the normal flow.
browser to `/iframe` to use the iframe flow.

pulltitle: Fix Content-Type coming from /api/auth_status
pullsbody:
Even though we were sending JSON in the body, it was being sent
with the Content-Type as 'text/html'. This fix means it'll be
sent as 'application/json'.
pull_commit_message:
Fix Content-Type coming from /api/auth_status

Even though we were sending JSON in the body, it was being sent
with the Content-Type as 'text/html'. This fix means it'll be
sent as 'application/json'.

pulltitle: Fix Content-Type coming from /api/auth_status
pullsbody:
Even though we were sending JSON in the body, it was being sent
with the Content-Type as 'text/html'. This fix means it'll be
sent as 'application/json'.

pulltitle: Log click and callback events for persona testing.
pullsbody:
@shane-tomlinson - mind reviewing? This should make it easy to add callback sequence checks to selenium tests.
- Comma-delimited text should be easy to parse inside selenium tests
  - Namespaced events so that callback-specific tests can ignore clicks, but
    manual tests can still verify click/callback interaction sequences
  - Toggle visibility on the logger node for feedback when debugging manually
pull_commit_message:
Log click and callback events for persona testing.

    * Comma-delimited text should be easy to parse inside selenium tests
    * Namespaced events so that callback-specific tests can ignore clicks, but
      manual tests can still verify click/callback interaction sequences
    * Toggle visibility on the logger node for feedback when debugging manually
